src:
Jenazah Pria Tewas Saat Selfie di Jembatan Youtefa Ditemukan
03 Nov 2019, 12:44 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Jenazah Respi Mulia, pemuda yang jatuh saat melakukan swafoto di luar Jembatan Youtefa, Jayapura, Papua berhasil ditemukan oleh tim SAR gabungan, Minggu.(PP Construction and Investment)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Jenazah Respi Mulia, pemuda yang jatuh saat melakukan swafoto di luar Jembatan Youtefa, Jayapura, Papua berhasil ditemukan oleh tim SAR gabungan, Minggu (4/11). Kepala SAR Jayapura Putu Arga di Jayapura, Minggu, mengatakan jenazah korban ditemukan sekitar pukul 08.40 WIT sekitar 1,5 kilometer dari lokasi tempatnya jatuh.Jenazah korban ditemukan berkat laporan nelayan yang melihat ada kain timbul dan setelah didekati ternyata mayat manusia."Korban ditemukan dalam keadaan telungkup dan sudah meninggal dunia," kata dia dikutip dari Antara.Tim SAR juga mengerahkan lima penyelam dari Basarnas Jayapura. Tim pencari terbagi menjadi dua regu, yakni regu pertama menggunakan "rubber boat" melakukan penyisiran ke arah laut Jayapura dengan jarak 3,6 kilometer, sedangkan tim kedua menyisir sepanjang tepi pantai Jembatan Youtefa.Korban jatuh pada Jumat (1/11) sekitar pukul 23.30 WIT, saat berfoto di luar Jembatan Youtefa, walaupun sempat diingatkan oleh tiga temannya.Kapolsek Jayapura Selatan Kompol Marthin Koagouw pada kesempatan terpisah mengaku sudah meminta keterangan tiga orang saksi yang juga rekan korban terkait dengan kejadian itu.Ia mengatakan teman-temannya sempat mengingatkan korban."Namun korban mengatakan tidak apa-apa karena ada yang duduk-duduk," katanya.Tak lama kemudian korban terjatuh dan sempat berteriak minta tolong sebelum hilang di perairan Teluk Youtefa. (chs)
text:
Man's Body Killed When Selfie on Youtefa Bridge Found
03 Nov 2019, 12:44 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


The body of Respi Mulia, a young man who fell while taking selfies outside the Youtefa Bridge, Jayapura, Papua, was found by a joint SAR team on Sunday. (PP Construction and Investment)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The body of Respi Mulia, a young man who fell while taking selfies outside the Youtefa Bridge, Jayapura, Papua, was found by a joint SAR team on Sunday (4/11). Jayapura SAR Head Putu Arga said in Jayapura on Sunday that the body of the victim was found at around 08.40 Eastern Indonesian Time about 1.5 kilometers from the location where it had fallen. The victim's body was found thanks to reports of fishermen who saw cloths arise and after being approached turned out to be a human corpse. the face down and has died, "he said quoted from Antara. The SAR team also mobilized five divers from Basarnas Jayapura. The search team was divided into two teams, namely the first team using a "rubber boat" conducted a search towards Jayapura sea with a distance of 3.6 kilometers, while the second team combed along the shore of the Youtefa Bridge. The victim fell on Friday (1/11) around 23.30 WIT, while taking pictures outside the Youtefa Bridge, despite being reminded by three of his friends. South Jayapura Police Chief Kompol Marthin Koagouw on a separate occasion claimed to have asked for information from three witnesses who were also fellow victims related to the incident. He said his friends had reminded the victim. "But the victim said it was okay because someone was sitting," he said. Not long after the victim fell and had screamed for help before disappearing in the waters of the Gulf of Youtefa. (chs)
